intro: Hugonia pentagyna, commonly known as the five-angled hugonia, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It features distinctive, five-angled stems that are often reddish in color. The plant produces small, white to pale green flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and typically have a rough texture. Hugonia pentagyna thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas.
